title: CEO Secrets: Juggling kids and a new lockdown business
description: Meet the new mums who have started businesses in lockdown.

title: Covid: How to protest during a global pandemic
description: Young activists explain the challenges they have faced in demonstrating during a global pandemic.

title: 'He can be world class' - Rashford upstages Mbappe in Paris again
description: For the second time in 19 months, Manchester United's Marcus Rashford steals the headlines in Paris. How good can the England striker be?

title: Christie hospital: Inside Europe's largest cancer unit
description: BBC Breakfast spent four days filming inside The Christie Hospital in Manchester, meeting patients and staff.

title: Mendy 'shows quality' as Chelsea frustrated in home draw with Sevilla
description: Chelsea suffer a frustrating start to their Champions League campaign after being held by Sevilla, their first goalless stalemate under Frank Lampard.

title: Coronavirus: 'I just wish my parents were still here'
description: Isaiah and Nathan's mother and father died from Covid-19 within two weeks of each other.

title: US election 2020: Why it can be hard to vote in the US
description: Long queues, weird rules and strict ID laws... what are the barriers to voting and why do they exist?

title: Five ways the virus has changed Netflix
description: Subscriber growth slows for the streaming giant, despite hits such as The Old Guard with Charlize Theron.

title: Liverpool centre-back Matip follows Van Dijk onto sidelines
description: Liverpool's defensive worries increase before the trip to take on Ajax as centre-back Joel Matip joins Virgil van Dijk on the sidelines.

title: 'Cost of removing cladding is ripping our lives apart'
description: Owners of flats with flammable cladding are angry they may have to pay towards the cost of replacing it.

title: Coronavirus: How are people breaking the rules?
description: Attitudes towards coronavirus restrictions are changing. But are people sticking to the rules?

title: US election 2020: What the results will mean for climate change
description: Who next occupies the White House could be decisive in the battle to limit global warming.

title: Brexit: Will the UK and the EU co-operate on security?
description: Ex-PM Theresa May says the government should not be resigned to no deal on security co-operation.

title: The Countdown: Mic dropped, 50 Cent and the Twitch Among Us vote
description: Hopes that Twitch will bring out the youth vote and 50 Cent has problems with Joe Biden's tax plan.

description: Peter Madsen was jailed for life in 2018 for murdering Swedish journalist Kim Wall.

description: The government had suggested tier three rules could be imposed if no deal was reached by noon.

title: UK plan to be first to run human challenge Covid trials
description: Volunteers will be deliberately exposed to the virus in trials due to start in January.

title: Man Utd's Zelem called up after Russo pulls out of England squad
description: Manchester United forward Alessia Russo withdraws from the England squad for next week's friendly against Germany because of a thigh injury, with team-mate Katie Zelem called-up.

title: First UK airport testing for outward passengers
description: The aim is to help people travelling to destinations where a negative result is required on arrival.

title: Drink and drugs driver jailed over Lesmahagow crash
description: Kanad Basi is sentenced to four years and eight months over a crash that killed 16-year-old Jack Frame.

title: Parole system in England and Wales 'secretive'
description: The grandson of a man who killed his wife calls for "greater scrutiny" of Parole Board hearings.

title: Cricket’s bio-secure bubbles ‘untenable’ - England captain Morgan
description: England players can withdraw from tours if playing in bio-secure bubbles is impacting their mental health, says Eoin Morgan.

title: Robert Redford: Retired actor mourns the death of his son James aged 58
description: The film star's son James dies aged 58, after being diagnosed with liver cancer.

title: Kyler Murray & Christian Kirk shine as Arizona Cardinals beat Dallas Cowboys
description: Quarterback Kyler Murray and Christian Kirk combine for two touchdowns as the Arizona Cardinals thrash the Dallas Cowboys 38-10.

title: Couple posed on rail line for wedding shoot
description: Network Rail says taking photos on a stretch of track was "plain stupidity".

title: Covid: Burn-out fears of 'exhausted' unpaid carers
description: Many of those looking after vulnerable relatives or friends wonder how they will cope this winter.

description: As the Champions League returns on Tuesday, BBC Sport's European football writers make their predictions.

title: Kylian Mbappe: Why PSG striker could move to Real Madrid or Liverpool
description: BBC Sport looks at what the future could hold for Paris St-Germain's France star Kylian Mbappe and asks if the striker could join Real Madrid or Liverpool.

title: The Papers: Lockdown 'by back door' and virus 'hidden victims'
description: Possible new restrictions for millions and a high non-Covid death toll lead the front pages.

title: How The Staves fought grief to find their way back to music
description: The folk-singing sisters had to put their career on pause after their mother died unexpectedly.

title: 'We had more than 60 calls from test and trace'
description: One family in London say they received scores of long, repetitive calls from contact tracers.

title: 'I'm Bengali, my boyfriend was black - and my mum freaked out'
description: Salma left home when her family urged her to get an abortion. Later she challenged her mum's anti-black prejudice.
